title: Mogambo — Job Finder Aggregator with Admin Panel and AdSense-Ready Layout

requirements.text: Set the application name to “Mogambo” across the UI (header/title text) and any app metadata that is user-visible.
acceptanceCriteria: The app’s main header/brand area displays “Mogambo”.
User-facing page titles/labels use “Mogambo” where appropriate.

requirements.text: Implement job search and discovery by aggregating listings from multiple configurable job portal sources: provide a unified search UI (keyword + location + optional filters) and a results list that normalizes common fields (title, company, location, source, date, apply URL).

quotes: Create an app for finding jobs using differents job portals available on internet

acceptanceCriteria: Users can enter a keyword and location and see a combined results list from all enabled sources.
Each result shows: job title, company (or “Unknown” if not provided), location (or “Remote/Unknown”), source name, posted date (or “Unknown”), and an “Apply” link that opens the original posting URL.
Results clearly indicate which source they came from.
If a source fails to fetch, the UI still renders results from other sources and shows a non-blocking error indicator.

requirements.text: Add backend support for managing job portal sources, including: storing a list of sources (name, base URL, fetch type such as JSON/RSS, enabled flag), fetching jobs from enabled sources via HTTPS outcalls where possible, and exposing query methods for the frontend to search across fetched results.

quotes: using differents job portals available on internet

acceptanceCriteria: An admin-configurable list of sources exists in backend state with fields: id, name, endpoint/base URL, enabled, and a simple type discriminator (e.g., RSS vs JSON).
Backend exposes methods to list sources and search jobs across enabled sources.
Backend handles partial failures per source and returns an aggregated response that includes per-source errors (non-fatal).

requirements.text: Create an Admin Panel that is accessible only to authenticated admin users and allows managing job sources (create/update/enable/disable/delete) and basic app settings relevant to aggregation and ads.
acceptanceCriteria: There is a dedicated Admin Panel route/screen accessible from the UI.
Non-admin users cannot access the Admin Panel (they are blocked and shown an appropriate message).
Admin users can add, edit, enable/disable, and delete job sources.
Admin users can change basic settings (at minimum: a toggle to enable/disable rendering ad slots and a text field for AdSense publisher/client id if needed for UI injection).

requirements.text: Implement authentication using Internet Identity and backend authorization for admin-only operations (admin list stored in backend; only admins can mutate sources/settings).
acceptanceCriteria: Users can sign in and sign out via Internet Identity.
Backend checks caller identity for admin-only methods and rejects non-admin callers.
There is a backend mechanism to manage the admin allowlist (e.g., initial admin bootstrap and an admin-only method to add/remove other admins).

requirements.text: Make the frontend AdSense-ready by adding clearly defined ad slots (e.g., header/banner and sidebar/in-feed placements) that can be toggled on/off via admin settings, and ensure the integration is implemented as a safe, optional script/embed with graceful fallback when ads are disabled or blocked.
acceptanceCriteria: The UI includes at least two distinct ad slot components/containers (e.g., top banner and in-results slot).
Ad slots render only when enabled in settings; otherwise they do not occupy space or show placeholders.
If ad loading fails (blocked/no client id), the app remains fully usable with no crashes.

requirements.text: Create a coherent, distinctive visual theme for Mogambo (colors, typography, layout, spacing) and apply it consistently across landing/search/results and the Admin Panel (avoid blue/purple as primary colors).

quotes: Create an app for finding jobs

acceptanceCriteria: App uses a consistent theme (color palette, type scale, and component styling) across all pages.
Primary colors are not blue/purple.
Search/results and admin screens feel visually part of the same product.

requirements.text: Add static generated brand assets and wire them into the UI: include a logo and favicon for Mogambo, and use them in the header and browser tab.
acceptanceCriteria: A Mogambo logo image is present in the repo under frontend/public/assets/generated and is displayed in the app header.
A Mogambo favicon is present under frontend/public/assets/generated and is used by the app.
Assets are served as static files (not via backend).

constraints: Backend must remain a single Motoko actor (all logic in backend/main.mo).

Do not edit frontend immutable paths: frontend/src/hooks/useInternetIdentity.ts, frontend/src/hooks/useInternetIdentity.tsx, frontend/src/hooks/useActor.ts, frontend/src/main.tsx, and anything under frontend/src/components/ui; compose/wrap these instead.
Authentication must use Internet Identity only (no third-party auth providers).
No external databases or cloud services; all persistence must be in canister state.
Avoid scraping job portals in ways that require a headless browser or violate portal terms; prefer public RSS/JSON endpoints or user-configured API endpoints where available.
nonGoals: Guaranteeing coverage of all job portals on the internet or perfect data normalization across every source.
Guaranteeing Google AdSense approval or ad fill; only provide an AdSense-ready integration layout and configuration.
Real-time job updates via websockets/push notifications.
Advanced features not requested (user profiles, resumes/CV builder, messaging/chat, email notifications).

required: Minimalist wordmark logo reading “Mogambo” with a bold, modern look (mogambo-logo.dim_512x192.png)
Wide, subtle background/hero illustration with abstract shapes and warm tones (mogambo-hero-bg.dim_1600x900.png)
